				<div id="mw-content-text" lang="en" dir="ltr" class="mw-content-ltr"><table class="infobox vcard" cellspacing="3" style="border-spacing:3px;width:22em;">
<tr>
<th colspan="2" class="fn org" style="text-align:center;font-size:125%;font-weight:bold;">China University of Geosciences</th>
</tr>
<tr>
<td colspan="2" style="text-align:center;">中国地质大学</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td colspan="2" style="text-align:center;">
<div class="center">

<td>Being austere and simple, keeping on practice and acting for truth</td>
</tr>

<th scope="row" style="text-align:left;">Established</th>
<td>October 1952</td>
</tr>

<td><a href="/wiki/National_university" title="National university">National</a> <a href="/wiki/Public_university" title="Public university">Public</a></td>
</tr>
<tr>

<td class="adr"><span class="locality"><a href="/wiki/Beijing" title="Beijing">Beijing</a> and <a href="/wiki/Wuhan" title="Wuhan">Wuhan</a></span>, <span class="country-name"><a href="/wiki/China" title="China">China</a></span></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<th scope="row" style="text-align:left;">Campus</th>

<tr>
<th scope="row" style="text-align:left;">Website</th>
<td><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.cugb.edu.cn/">www.cugb.edu.cn (Beijing)</a><br />
<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.cug.edu.cn/">www.cug.edu.cn (Wuhan)</a></td>
</tr>
</table>
<p>The <b>China University of Geosciences</b> (<a href="/wiki/Simplified_Chinese_characters" title="Simplified Chinese characters">simplified Chinese</a>: <span lang="zh-Hans" xml:lang="zh-Hans">中国地质大学</span>; <a href="/wiki/Traditional_Chinese_characters" title="Traditional Chinese characters">traditional Chinese</a>: <span lang="zh-Hant" xml:lang="zh-Hant">中地|大W</span>; <a href="/wiki/Pinyin" title="Pinyin">pinyin</a>: <em>Zhōngguó Dìzhì Dàxué</em>; colloquially 地大; ) is a key national university directly under the administration of the <a href="/wiki/Education_Ministry_of_the_People%27s_Republic_of_China" title="Education Ministry of the People's Republic of China" class="mw-redirect">Education Ministry of the People's Republic of China</a>. It consists of two campuses, one is located in <a href="/wiki/Haidian_District" title="Haidian District">Haidian District</a> in <a href="/wiki/Beijing" title="Beijing">Beijing</a>, and the other in <a href="/wiki/Wuhan" title="Wuhan">Wuhan</a>, the capital of Central China's <a href="/wiki/Hubei_Province" title="Hubei Province" class="mw-redirect">Hubei Province</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-en_1-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-en-1"><span>[</span>1<span>]</span></a></sup> <sup id="cite_ref-br_2-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-br-2"><span>[</span>2<span>]</span></a></sup></p>
<p>It is regarded as a top university specialized in geosciences in China and exerts considerable influence within the Chinese mining and oil industry. Its notable alumni include <a href="/wiki/Wen_Jiabao" title="Wen Jiabao">Wen Jiabao</a>, the <a href="/wiki/Premier" title="Premier">Premier</a> of <a href="/wiki/China%27s_State_Council" title="China's State Council" class="mw-redirect">China's State Council</a>, who attended the Beijing Campus when it was known as the Beijing Institute of Geology (BIG).<sup id="cite_ref-en_1-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-en-1"><span>[</span>1<span>]</span></a></sup> <sup id="cite_ref-br_2-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-br-2"><span>[</span>2<span>]</span></a></sup></p>

<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Campuses">Campuses</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=China_University_of_Geosciences&amp;action=edit&amp;section=1" title="Edit section: Campuses">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Beijing_Campus"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.cugb.edu.cn">Beijing Campus</a></span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=China_University_of_Geosciences&amp;action=edit&amp;section=2" title="Edit section: Beijing Campus">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<p>The Beijing Campus is located in the original campus of former Beijing Institute of Geology, Xueyuan Road, with a concentration of 8 famous universities and academic tradition.<sup id="cite_ref-en_1-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-en-1"><span>[</span>1<span>]</span></a></sup> <sup id="cite_ref-br_2-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-br-2"><span>[</span>2<span>]</span></a></sup></p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Wuhan_Campus"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.cug.edu.cn/">Wuhan Campus</a></span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=China_University_of_Geosciences&amp;action=edit&amp;section=3" title="Edit section: Wuhan Campus">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<p>The Wuhan Campus is located in No. 388 Lumo Road, Wuhan, with a scenic view and a large campus area. It has a larger annual enrollment and provides more available majors other than geosciences.<sup id="cite_ref-en_1-3" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-en-1"><span>[</span>1<span>]</span></a></sup> <sup id="cite_ref-br_2-3" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-br-2"><span>[</span>2<span>]</span></a></sup> Its Yifu Museum is known for housing China’s top ranked displays of dinosaur fossils, mineral and rock specimens.</p>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="History">History</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=China_University_of_Geosciences&amp;action=edit&amp;section=4" title="Edit section: History">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<p>The history of China University of Geosciences dates back to <b>Beijing Institute of Geology</b> (BIG)(<a href="/wiki/Simplified_Chinese_characters" title="Simplified Chinese characters">simplified Chinese</a>: <span lang="zh-Hans" xml:lang="zh-Hans">北京地质学院</span>; <a href="/wiki/Traditional_Chinese_characters" title="Traditional Chinese characters">traditional Chinese</a>: <span lang="zh-Hant" xml:lang="zh-Hant">北京地|W院</span>; <a href="/wiki/Pinyin" title="Pinyin">pinyin</a>: <em>Běijīng Dìzhì Xuéyuàn</em>) which was a merger of the geology departments of <a href="/wiki/Tsinghua_University" title="Tsinghua University">Tsinghua University</a>, <a href="/wiki/Peking_University" title="Peking University">Peking University</a>, <a href="/wiki/Tianjin_University" title="Tianjin University">Tianjin University</a> and <a href="/wiki/Southwest_Jiaotong_University" title="Southwest Jiaotong University">Tangshan Railway College</a>. It was among China's first 16 key universities back in the 1950s. The university suspended operations from 1966-1970 due to the <a href="/wiki/Cultural_Revolution" title="Cultural Revolution">Cultural Revolution</a>, and reopened in <a href="/wiki/Jiangling_County" title="Jiangling County">Jiangling County</a>, Hubei Province, in 1970 as <b>Hubei Institute of Geology</b> (<a href="/wiki/Simplified_Chinese_characters" title="Simplified Chinese characters">simplified Chinese</a>: <span lang="zh-Hans" xml:lang="zh-Hans">湖北地质学院</span>; <a href="/wiki/Traditional_Chinese_characters" title="Traditional Chinese characters">traditional Chinese</a>: <span lang="zh-Hant" xml:lang="zh-Hant">湖北地|W院</span>; <a href="/wiki/Pinyin" title="Pinyin">pinyin</a>: <em>Húběi Dìzhì Xuéyuàn</em>).<sup id="cite_ref-3" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-3"><span>[</span>3<span>]</span></a></sup></p>
<p>In 1975 the campus was moved to <a href="/wiki/Wuhan" title="Wuhan">Wuhan</a>, and the school was renamed <b>Wuhan Institute of Geology</b> (WIG) (<a href="/wiki/Simplified_Chinese_characters" title="Simplified Chinese characters">simplified Chinese</a>: <span lang="zh-Hans" xml:lang="zh-Hans">武汉地质学院</span>; <a href="/wiki/Traditional_Chinese_characters" title="Traditional Chinese characters">traditional Chinese</a>: <span lang="zh-Hant" xml:lang="zh-Hant">武h地|W院</span>; <a href="/wiki/Pinyin" title="Pinyin">pinyin</a>: <em>Wǔhàn Dìzhì Xuéyuàn</em>). In 1978 BIG reopened in Beijing with the help of <a href="/wiki/Deng_Xiaoping" title="Deng Xiaoping">Deng Xiaoping</a>. In 1986 the Chinese Government ratified the foundation of the Graduate School of WIG. It was ranked as one of the first 33 Graduate Schools nationwide. Later in 1987 BIG and WIG were renamed <b>China University of Geosciences （Beijing）</b>and <b>China University of Geosciences （Wuhan）</b>, respectively. CUG is among the first batch of 15 universities in <a href="/wiki/Project_211" title="Project 211">project 211 for Higher Education</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-en_1-4" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-en-1"><span>[</span>1<span>]</span></a></sup> <sup id="cite_ref-br_2-4" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-br-2"><span>[</span>2<span>]</span></a></sup></p>
